status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Inspector investigated and determined the following:. National Grid posted your street to perform utility work. We have told permittees when they post a street in Boston they must show up for the dates indicated on the sign. Parking is a premium and we acknowledge that is is frustrating moving your car and not having anyone show up. We understand that sometimes construction has unforeseen issues like equipment breakdowns, asphalt plants not available etc. resulting in not working the days posted. However we have told the permittees they must change the dates on the signs to reflect the new work dates. National Grid removed the signs and will repost and make sure they work on those days. We apologize for the inconvenience you incurred. For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Noted. I spoke with complainant William Somers  at 2:30pm on 09-20-2017.   I explained to Mr Somers that we had already spoke with transportation department in the past and they placed pedestrian crossing signs on the poles close to crosswalk.   Mr Somers was interested in having pedestrian sign in crosswalk bolted to the ground similiar to one at 720 E Broadway.   I explained to Mr Somers they couldn't put one like that at intersection of W Broadway / B street because the buses would keep running over it trying to make turn.  I told him I would have BTD check on one for the intersection of W broadway / C street but again trucks may drive over them making deliveries to Foodies and liqour store on opposite corner.  I also told him that our traffic enforcement units are giving out citations to motorists in response to complaints of M/V failing to stop for pedestrians.   Mr Somers stated he was just making a suggestion not a complaint and has seen signs put up by BTD but he wishes motorists would do the same.     I gave him number of the C6 CSO office to call with any further questions.   Thank You Officer Sullivan C6 CSO.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Inspector investigated and determined the following:. A property owner on Athens St hired a contractor to install the new water services. A Police detail was called for this job. Sometimes, the details are not filled, or a Police officer is up the street, giving the impression that there was no police detail called. Athens St as you know is very narrow, but the contractor should have allowed you access to your driveway.  We will speak to him. The good news is the job has been completed. description:
Good morning,
 
The businesses located at the end of Locust Street have been placing orange cones on both sides of Locust Street each evening to reserve the public parking spaces on the street for their business’s use the following day.  Over the past few weeks, orange construction barrels have now been placed across Locust Street to block public access from Buttonwood Street to the end of Locust Street.  In and of itself, this is concerning since the businesses are attempting to privatize a public way.  What’s more concerning about this practice is, the businesses are also blocking access to a fire hydrant that provides service to the neighborhood.  Would you please help end this practice so the Fire Department again has unimpeded access to the fire hydrant and the public can again have the right to use this area of Locust Street for parking in the evening?
 
Thank you very much for your assistance.
address: Intersection Of Buttonwood St & Locust St, Dorchester

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) investigated and determined the following:. National Grid is replacing a gas main that is over 100 years old. In addition to replacing a 100 year old main National Grid is replacing every gas service to each resident. The City highly encourages this type of work. It will eliminate possible future emergency leak repairs.   Especially if we plan on paving the street in the future. The City acknowledges that the construction will cause an inconvenience to the residents. However replacing mains over 100 years old ensures solid dependable gas service for another 100 years. We have instructed Feeney not to have their trucks idle before work starts. In addition, because of the tight parking on Houghton St, we have asked them not to work on Saturdays. For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) Inspector investigated and determined the following:. Eversource Electric was notified by Public Works that their previous work was unacceptable to our standards. The trench has to be smooth and level. What you saw was the contractor coming back and attempting to do the repairs. All contractors working in the City of Boston are required to have Police details. A Police detail was called for this job. Sometimes, the details are not filled, or a Police officer is up the street,. Unfortunately in this case, the detail was not filled. The PWD has reached out to the Boston Police about the need to fill the detail requests. The City apologizes for the inconvenience for this necessary work. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951 Office.
description: Construction vehicles asking people to move there cars where is the police detail

status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. You are absolutely right. All day today cars have been exiting Juniper St and Rockledge st and turning down Thornton st the wrong way which is a one way. It's an accident waiting to happen.  
The only reason I'm submitting this 311 report is that it has been more than half a dozen cars just today and am afraid that people bare going to become accustom to driving down this street the wrong way instead of going up the hill to cedar st or logan st to get to Washington st.
Somehow this needs  to be stopped.
The street signs are clearly posted DO NOT ENTER-ONE WAY 
so not sure other than getting a ticket will stop them.

description: Your trucks aren't pulling over. They held up traffic on Allston side streets for 17 minutes today. This is the second time I have complained about this. The first time you guys said you don't condone this behavior and apologized, but this time I'd like to know what action you plan to take. These guys can easily pull over and choose not to. They don't even pretend to care when an entire traffic jammed street is honking at them. Believe it or not, people actually have places to go. The license plate on the truck is L31-306 and they held up traffic today (9/14) between 10:30-10:47am on Gardner Street in Allston. I can't imagine no one else is complaining about this because it happens every week. Please do something.
